body_content.explanation: to have to have something, or to want something very much:
examples: Babies need constant care.
The doctor said I needed an operation.
I need to go to the toilet.
Most people need to feel loved.
I need you to help me choose an outfit.
I badly need (= strongly want) a rest from all this.
I don't need all this hassle.

body_content.explanation: If you say that someone or something needs something else, you mean that they should have it, or would get an advantage from having it:
examples: What you need is a nice hot bowl of soup.
This room needs cleaning.
She needs her hair washed.
He needs to lose some weight.
I need to do some shopping on my way home from work.
There needs to be more effort from everyone.
I don't think we need ask him.
Nothing need be done about this till next week.
"Need we take your mother?" "No, we needn't."

body_content.explanation: there is no reason for someone or something to do a particular thing:
examples: You needn't worry - I'm not going to mention it to anyone.
It's a wonderful way of getting to see Italy, and it needn't cost very much.

body_content.explanation: used, often when you are angry with someone, to say that they should not do a particular thing or that they have no right to do it:
examples: He needn't think I'm driving him all the way there!
You needn't laugh! It'll be your turn next!

body_content.explanation: used to say either that someone did a particular thing although they did not have to, or that someone did not do it because they did not have to:
examples: I gave her some extra money - I know I didn't need to but I thought it would be kind.
"Did you ask Sophia to help?" "I didn't need to - I managed perfectly well on my own."

body_content.explanation: it was not necessary for someone to have done a particular thing, although they did do it:
examples: You needn't have washed all those dishes, you know - I'd have done them myself when I got home.
You needn't have worried about the dinner - it was delicious!

body_content.explanation: the state of having to have something that you do not have, especially something that you must have so that you can have a satisfactory life:
examples: Are you in need of help?
There's a growing need for cheap housing in the larger cities.

body_content.explanation: the things that a person must have in order to have a satisfactory life:
examples: Housing and education are basic needs.
They don't have enough food to meet their needs.

body_content.explanation: a feeling or state of strongly wanting something:
examples: He seems to have a desperate need to be loved by everyone.
I don't know about you but I'm in need of a drink.
We have no need of your sympathy.

body_content.explanation: not having enough money or food:
examples: You just hope that the money goes to those who are most in need.
Help yourself to stationery as the need arises.
If need/needs be (= if necessary), we can take a second car to fit everyone in.
I don't think there's any need for all of us to attend the meeting.

body_content.explanation: If there is no need to do something, it is not necessary or it is wrong:
examples: There's no need to buy more food - there's plenty in the fridge.
I understand why she was angry, but there was no need to be so nasty to him.
There's no need to yell! Just calm down.
